title: When my team bans my Pick Intent
body:
[](https://i.imgflip.com/16zaje.gif)
https://media.giphy.com/media/l41YigPMOPyS8EjC0/giphy.gif
This is why I rarely use that feature.

replies.body: GODDAMN IT GUYS. STOP BANNING MY SUPPORT YORICK. I SWEAR I AM NOT TROLLING.
Ah I've heard of the legendary Yorick main, is it thou?
http://image.prntscr.com/image/66e9834cc95248edaaeb48e128b2c398.png

SO THE LEGENDS WERE TRUE!

How the hell did you get to level 7 with only 34.9K?  I know 6 and 7 are tied to S's, but it looks like you haven't played Yorick that long.
It is called no one plays Yorick Support, so I get an S or S+ pretty much every single game.
Please team up with me. I'll kiss your feet.
Lel
[](https://media.giphy.com/media/iiS84hOJXh1Pq/giphy.gif)
You have been playing a lot of this haven't you ._.
Yes.

I've done this, but it doesn't really work well lol. We won but i didn't contribute much. I think the only champs i cant win with as support are Ashe and Garen. 

I felt so bad for trying.

Better yet they PICK your champ ahead of time to troll you, not intending to trade

http://mylolface.com/assets/faces/angry-must-resist.jpg
had that happen when I was trying to get level 7 on Sona, ended up picking Garen support and carrying
Yasuo mains probably know this feeling.
Who would bother to ban Sion anyway?

https://media.giphy.com/media/l2JJNLLZbSHcW4Tuw/giphy.gif
It makes no sense. They only do it to troll their team.
if someone in your team is showing any sort of disliking to you (asks for your roll and you say no or something like that) just pick who you want banned and boom, their banned for you

I once played ap riven because my team banned my champion intentionally. even laughed at me in champ select for intending to play taliyah. I still feel kinda guilty about it but it was the best feeling in a while to see those 4 premades crying.

http://www.versusbattle.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/03/darth-vader.jpg
Do not feel sorry for those fools. The force is strong in you. 
Victory is to those who dare to rule!

I just had a game where I think I banned one of my teammates pick intent. I thought I looked at our teams champions, saw that no one was picking Hecarim, and then banned him, but the jungler must have chosen him at the last second or I'm extremely oblivious or he didn't choose him, because after I banned Hecarim I saw my jungler's summoner spells were Ghost and Smite. I asked him in chat if he wanted to pick it, and he said "wtf yeah" and then I felt really badly and behaved apologetically. He asked me to dodge, which I didn't do, but I did offer him mid. He accepted the trade, but once the opponent locked in Yasuo, he declined and told me to go mid. He then went Ryze jungle.
I thought he might be trolling because of me and I felt even worse. Looking back on it, I feel like he was trying to make someone dodge. In game, he got executed at Wolves, and when he came to the Red Brambleback, the enemy Elise invaded him and tried to kill him. I instantly thought, "This is my chance to prove to Ryze that I'm really sorry!" and I came over to help him, killing the Elise and helping him get away.
He didn't behave angrily during the game and he did pretty well, getting a S for doing decently on a champion in an unorthodox position.

That's my story about banning pick intents.
So I have to be Ryze jungle to get an S?

> [{quoted}](name=HadesThomas,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=1ydRGyOR,comment-id=000b0000,timestamp=2016-07-07T11:13:21.008+0000)
>
> So I have to be Ryze jungle to get an S?

No, we also had an amazing Morgana support get a S+ in that game, going 6/1/30/69 in a 42:09 minute game with 36k damage dealt to champions, 43 wards placed, and 4 wards destroyed.

I've gotten a few S's with Ryze top lane, but none mid lane since I don't play him mid lane as much. You do have to carry though. Ryze is a hypercarry champion, so the top percentage of players _will_ have really good scores, so you'll need to match that if you want a S on Ryze. High CS, high kills, high assists, low deaths, lots of champion damage, a decent amount of wards placed, and a low game time are all things you can work towards so that you can get your S rank.
Only happened once to me, that being said I banned fizz and our midlaner apparently had it for his POT... His orb was empty I swear

If I see someone with a Sion pick intent, it usually means a good game. An experienced Sion player will absolutely destroy the enemy team.

But if you pick intent Swain, you're outta luck bud xD

You got that right, buddy!

https://media.giphy.com/media/3oEjHAYTExYLIXDPDa/giphy.gif

COOOOWWWWAAAAARRRRRDDDSSSS

Oh ****, I remembered. Only game I got against Sion as an inexperienced Gangplank and I get put up against a good Sion. 

Life hates me.

I've never actually intentionally banned someone's intended pick, although I have been yelled at for banning a champion someone was apparently going to play but they didn't think it was worth it to tell their team. They just left their intended pick empty. Like what?

I sometimes just cycle through champions and land on someone random for fun (no one I actually play has a high ban rate, plus I always have back ups). I remember this one Jhin got all pissy because I had it set to Talon support despite being in the previous lobby with him and picking Janna when the time came (I did the same thing then too). He insisted that my team ban talon the second time around because he didn't want Talon support (not like I was going to but it was funny how pissy he got).
don't tell your team to leave your pick unbanned, and 99% your pick will not banned {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
Unless you play Zed. Then you better let everyone know before they ban him
And if you're last pick im still banning him tbh
You could try to communicate and trade... (just a thought)
If I'm banning too it means im 3-4th pick and can't really do that :P
Honestly I often feel this way when people do not put up any pick intent bc I can not adjust my pic for sake of team composition.
Unless it's a bronze player wanting to play Yasuo, that's a dick move.

> [{quoted}](name=MrMegasam,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=1ydRGyOR,comment-id=000d,timestamp=2016-07-07T01:06:28.847+0000)
>
> Unless it's a bronze player wanting to play Yasuo, that's a dick move.

I'm b3 rank 7 335k mastery Yasuo T^T

Me-"pick intents sona for mid"

Team-sona mid? Caitlyn promptly bans sona instead of someone like yasou. And then proceeds to say oops.. Didn't see your pick. 

I mean sona is like the 126th least banned champ according to op.gg. Yet my last game with her mid I went 11-4-12 or something like that.

Yep. Worst thing is when you can't reselect no champion for pick intent. So they just see you quickly go from Lee support to Alistar and start suspecting something, the only thing you can say is "missclick". What I usually do is pick intent Alistar, go through the whole support roster, stop at Blitz by 10 seconds left then just in the last second lock in Lee Sin. Sure to get people raging.
Times like this u bust out tank teemo or AP Draven .
hehe xd

"When my team bans my Pick Intent"

When my team bans my intent pick
Yeah I know that feel.
As a sion player I know your pain
I do that all the time to Fizz players... I always ban him and forget to look at intents
I can say that every time I've banned someone's pick intent is because I wasn't paying close enough attention..
I want them to. Because then I'm going Ashe support and showing them what the true definition of suffering is.
thats why i dont use pick intent since id rather have my pick not banned but it gets stolen from me 90% of the time
